content: London Symphony Orchestra Music Explorer Home Page. An online educational resource with a variety of creative classroom projects designed by Richard McNichol.

content: MENC is pleased to present the following online resource to musiceducators and anyone interested in supporting music education. If you findthis information useful, we ask that you consider sending $5.00 to MENC tohelp defray the costs of publishing free resources on the Internet. If youchoose to do so, please send your contribution to MENC: The NationalAssociation for Music Education (attn: Elizabeth Lasko), 1806 RobertFulton Drive, Reston, VA 20191. Checks should be made payable to MENC.Please note the resource(s) you utilized; this will help us plan futureonline resources. If you have any questions, contact

content: brings the London Symphony Orchestra, conducted by Sir Colin Davis, to you in your home or in your classroom.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p b span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: consists of a videotape and a 64 page listening guidebook written by Richard McNicol.

content: The guidebook sets out for each piece:

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: an introductory page that sets the scene, describing the circumstances in which the piece was written (where possible, in the composer's own words).

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li b span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Pages that help the listener get an overall impression of the music by discovering landmarks that give an idea of the span of the piece.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li b span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Explores the way the music is put together (the form).

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li b span
content: 3rd listenings: The icing on the cake.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Guides to some of the things that make the music most admirable to the author--designed to provoke involvement and individual response. This section also contains "secrets of the performance" (about gestures, expressions, and interactions among the people making the music on the tape) and "can you discover..." (questions to encourage students to explore a little further for themselves).

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li b span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Answers some of the questions brought up in the introduction: "How was the first performance received?" "What then happens to the composer?" "How does this composer fit into musical history?"

content: package includes a variety of printed exercises useful for individual or for class study. In addition, author Richard McNicol has designed a variety of creative classroom projects. Here are six such projects, chosen for their effectiveness in helping students reach the National Standards in Music Education of the United States of America (note that the Music Explorer materials all are directed toward Standard 9: Understanding music in relation to history and culture).

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: Note that the sound files that appear in some of these lessons are in MIDI format. You will be able to play them only if your computer is set up to accomodate such files, and the sound quality will depend on the quality of your computer sound card and other hardware.
